thread.title: Here are the 10 top-selling neighborhoods in Houston
thread.title_full: Here are the 10 top-selling neighborhoods in Houston

author: Paul Takahashi
title: Here are the 10 top-selling neighborhoods in Houston
text: In 2016, local Realtors sold a record 76,449 single-family homes in the Houston… more Feverpitched However, some neighborhoods saw more sales than others. Katy-Southwest had the most home sales in the Houston area with 2,451, a 1 percent decline from 2015, according to HAR. Despite job losses in the energy sector, families are drawn to the west Houston suburb’s well-respected schools and proximity to the Energy Corridor. Pearland had the second-highest home sales in the Bayou City with 2,416, a 2 percent increase from 2015, according to HAR. Families, especially those working in the medical sector, are attracted to the south Houston suburb’s well-respected schools and proximity to the Texas Medical Center. The Woodlands, which ranked as the No. 3 hottest neighborhood in 2015, saw sales fall by 4.8 percent in 2016, landing the north Houston suburb in the No. 5 spot. Realtors sold 1,930 homes in The Woodlands in 2016, down from 2,027 homes sold in 2015. Luxury home sales have fallen amid the oil slump, and new home sales have slowed as the mature master-planned community nears build-out . Cypress, League City, Fort Bend County, Spring and the Lake Conroe area were all hot neighborhoods for home sales in 2016, according to HAR. Here are the top 10 hottest Houston neighborhoods for home sales, according to HAR: Katy-Southwes t: 2,451 home sales in 2016 (-1 percent year over year); Ranked No. 1 in 2015 Pearland : 2,416 sales (+2 percent YOY); Ranked No. 2 in 2015 Cypress North : 2,028 sales (+2.5 percent YOY); Ranked No. 5 in 2015 League City : 2,019 sales (+2 percent YOY); Ranked No. 4 in 2015 The Woodlands : 1,930 sales (-4.8 percent YOY); Ranked No. 3 in 2015 Fort Bend County North/Richmond : 1,718 sales (+6.9 percent YOY); Ranked No. 6 in 2015 Spring Northeast : 1,717 sales (+11.9 percent YOY); Ranked No. 10 in 2015 Katy-North : 1,549 sales (+2.4 percent YOY); Ranked No. 9 in 2015 Lake Conroe : 1,542 sales (-1.7 percent YOY); Ranked No. 7 in 2015 Spring/Klein/Tombal l: 1,450 sales (+10.6 percent YOY); Ranked No. 10 in 2015 Paul Takahashi covers residential and multifamily commercial real estate, as well as education, for the Houston Business Journal. Follow him on Twitter for more. Home of the Day
